description: Learn more about how malaria affects the people of Rwanda
title: Malaria in Rwanda
content:
Malaria is a dangerous threat in Rwanda, so it is important to take precautions and protect yourself and your family from the disease.  Here is how malaria affected Rwanda in 2012:

 - 100% of the population of Rwanda was living in an at-risk area where the malaria parasite was present.

 - It is estimated that 650,000 people caught the disease, and 3,800 died, just from a simple mosquito bite.

 - Malaria has cost Rwanda approximately 1,950,000 productive work days, which has a detrimental impact on the county’s overall economy.

**How you can help**

It doesn’t have to be this way.  You can help protect your family, and your country, from malaria by taking a few simple steps:

 - Make sure your whole family sleeps under a bed net every night.

 - Seek testing, and then treatment, from a doctor or health worker at the first sign of illness.

 - If you are given treatment, make sure to finish your pills!

To learn more about malaria in your country, visit the Rwanda malaria program.
